canvases.label: Charter by Countess Ada, granting to Alexander St Martin the lands of Elstanesford, recto

metadata.value: Charter by Countess Ada, granting to Alexander St Martin the lands of Elstanesford
metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: Ada de Warenne (Mother of Malcolm IV and William the Lion of Scotland)
metadata.label: Creator

metadata.value: Page 1 of 2. Written in Latin. Charter by Ada the Countess, mother of the king of Scots, granting to ALEXANDER OF ST. MARTIN the lands of Elstanesford, by those same marches by which King David gave the same Elstanesford to him; she, moreover, gives Barowe, Donecaneslaye, Bangelaye, and the land which Vhtred, son of Gilise, held, and that land which is on the east side of Seton (‘Seitonie’), by those marches by which her men walked the lands and delivered them to him; also the site of his mill on the Tyne, and one carucate of land in ‘CCarelsira’ [Craillshire], to wit, in Petollin, and one full toft in Hadinton, and another toft in Carel, all to be held in fee and heritage for the service of one knight, with ‘sake’ and ‘soke’, ‘tol’ and ‘them’, ‘infandthef,’ and other liberties. Witnesses, David, son of the Countess, Hugh Giffard [torn] of Cenef, Roger of Valouin, Walter Giffard, Hugh of Baillol, and William Giffard. (Date between A.D. 1153 and 1178.). One of the oldest charters in the collection. A small portion of the seal remains attached but it is heavily damaged and no evidence of its imprint still remains. Unlike later seals that are either brown from beeswax or red in more modern colorings, this seal has a natural greenish hue that would be more common in this time than later on when coloring became more prominent. Most of the seals in the collection are a muted brown or red, making this seal a unique object in the manuscript collection. Information on the charter found from: Anderson, John, Rev, ed. Calendar of the Laing Charters, A.D. 854-1837 Belonging to the University of Edinburgh.
metadata.label: Description
